poem:
When Knowledge Commands a Price

Blueprint dreams in golden cages,
tuition tailored, wealth engages.
Architect's pencil stroked with might,
salaries soar, sevenfold flight.
Oxfords tutor riches keep,
where banknotes whisper young to sleep.
Bricks and mortar, lessons bought,
education's worth, a sum is sought.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "The booming world of specialised private education for super-rich Wanted: part-time tutor for a budding young architect student. Potential pay: over £2m. Welcome to the booming world of specialised private education for the super-rich where earnings for tutoring, even when moonlighting, now dwarf conventional salaries. This week, architects reacted with astonishment when an Oxford tutor agency offered a salary seven times higher than that of the average building designer for an “excellent young professional architect". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
